title: Firefox will not sync properly
content: I can spend 30-45 minutes sorting and cleaning my bookmarks, but Sync does not recognize this. It does not delete files as I do. Same goes when I try and sync or update my phone of laptop, I end up with so many extra bookmarks (Many duplicates and triplicates). Sync seems to only work one way, It adds bookmarks and folders I add, it sorts them as I do, But it does not delete anything as I do. Sync should operate on the most resent changes made to my bookmarks not just keep adding and adding. I have tried many times to clean my bookmarks, but as soon as I press sync it adds back everything I deleted. Absolutely terrible. title: Viewing PDFs in Firefox but opening them with a PDF Viewer
content:
Hi, Up to the most recent update of Firefox I could preview PDFs within a cloud based software, but when I downloaded them they opened up in my default PDF Viewer.

Since the update the preview PDFs in the software just spin and never show, unless I have the setting in Firefox set to "open in Firefox" then I can see them. But if I have that set, then any PDF I try to open or download will open in a new Tab in Firefox, rather than the PDF viewer, and then I have to save it to be able to open it in the PDF viewer.

However, if I change the setting to be "Use Windows Default Application" they open up just fine in the PDF viewer, but the previews in the cloud based software go back to spinning and not opening.

How do I get back to having both things happen, rather than either / or please?

Many thanks for any help offered Best regards Jen

title: Restore or re-Sync my Bookmarks from mozilla to my Account
content:
My account was recently hacked by someone using find-it pro hijacker after i clicked on a phishing/spam email disguised as a git-hub repository for AI/machine learning.

The hacker gained access to my google,MS,linkedin,X and other email accounts he removed my profile photo on linkedin and deleted all my education and employment details, he also went to X and changed my name from Daniel to (Tesla Investor) in order to deceive innocent people,he also deleted or synced a lot of my emails in a bid to sieve for financial data he can use to compromise my banking and card details

i have been able to recover all the accounts, made a police report to protect myself in case of impersonation and also following up with the x-support team to unmask his identity as he even posted! from my account.

I had to wipe out everything Firefox from my system as i did not know exactly what directory had been compromised unfortunately l lost all my bookmarks of years containing many links and urls i frequently categorized for my education and professional development

I prefer Firefox because the browser allows a user to create folders and subfolders and then bookmark any url or site for future reference and ease of navigation e.g (software eng -> frontend,backend,ml) i have hundreds of bookmarks and folders and i can no longer see anything as i performed a clean installation and used malware bytes to remove the infections that had hidden themselves in various system folders on my local machine, everything including my passwords had also been synced to the hacker's local machine.

Is there anyway Firefox can help me restore or sync back all these hundreds/if not thousands of bookmarks and folders on my account from their own servers, i just feel a loss in enthusiasm that someone could just take away in an instant years of hardwork, it is hard for me to start bookmarking all these information that took years to arrange neatly in my firefox folders so that if i sign in on another system, i can easily continue my work as a developer.

I would appreciate if anyone can guide me on how to reach Mozilla team if they can help to get a re-sync if possible even if it is up to Jan 31, 2025

Going forward i wont store any passwords on Mozilla again as i have gone to the settings to turn all these features the hacker exploited off, but just bookmarks and i have setup 2fa too on all my most sensitive work and email sites.
creator: femodaniel

title: userChrome.css-Bookmark/Edit Bookmark... context menu spaces
content:
Hello.

Re: Bookmark/Edit Bookmark... right click context menu spaces

How can I reduce the spaces for the context menu for Bookmark/Edit Bookmark... A bookmark right click menus are reduced already, however the Edit Bookmark... opens up then right click the menus (Undo, Redo, etc)are, I think, in the original wider spaces. Currently my userChrome.css is as follow to reduce spaces, /* Tighten up drop-down/context/popup menu spacing */ menupopup:not(.in-menulist) > menuitem, menupopup:not(.in-menulist) > menu {padding-block: 0px !important; min-height: 0pix !important;}

root {--arrowpanel-menuitem-margin: 0px 8px !important; --arrowpanel-menuitem-padding: 0px 8px !important;}

Regards,

Enable WebGL:

title: Yer İmleri
content:
Merhaba, Bugün Firefox Nightly sürümünü kullanırken güncelleme olduğunu gördüm ve güncelleme yaptım. Güncelleme yaptıktan sonra Firefox Nightly açılmaz oldu. Yeni Firefox sekmesi oluştu ve bu sekme ile giriş yaptım. Ama yeni sekmede daha öncede Firefox Nightly'de kayıtlı olan tüm yer imleri (sık kullandığım web sayfaları) silindi. Firefox'un yardım bölümünden araştırdım. Sonuç aşağıda ki şekilde yapabileceğim şeklindeydi.

Yardım sayfasından Ayarlardan "Menü" paneline girip, Yer imleri'ne tıkladım ve ardından Yer imlerini yönet'e tıkladım. Arşiv penceresi araç çubuğunda ki "İçe aktarma ve yedekleme"ye tıkladım. Ancak sonraki açıklamada belirtilen "Başka bir tarayıcıdaki verileri içe aktar" bölümü pasif olduğu için tıklayamadım.

Daha önce sık kullandığım kayıtlı web sayfalarını (Yer İmleri) nasıl geri getirebilirim. Yardımcı olur musunuz lütfen?

title: password input appears while i'm typing in the address bar
content:
I have a (few) websites which firefox has stored passwords. If I start typing "c..." into the address bar, firefox IMMEDIATELY shows the "Password Required" prompt, stealing focus from the address bar and continuing my typing in the password field.

The event that shows the prompt should NOT be driven by auto-filling suggestions in the address bar, but actually selecting and loading a page.

title: Firefox Showing UK Currency in US?
content:
For whatever reason, when I open certain websites in Firefox, it shows the prices in UK currency including VAT, but when I open the same websites in Chrome, they show up in US currency. The Windows region setting and the VPN connection is the exact same for both. The difference is the browser.

Is there some setting in Firefox that makes it think I am in the UK, and if so, how do I change that?
